head.title: A Tax That Seems to Hit a Nerve

hedline.hl1: A Tax That Seems to Hit a Nerve

abstract.p: Noam Grunes letter on Alan Wolfe's July 24 article questions his argument for estate tax repeal

block.p: Alan Wolfe (Op-Ed, July 24) poignantly observes broad interest in repealing the estate tax, but justifies it by misrepresenting a large school of thought. Sociobiologists would be hard pressed to identify sacrificing for one's children as ''the very definition of altruism.'' True altruism extends beyond family.

It does not require a follower of Immanuel Kant to appreciate the societal benefits of distributed wealth. Incentives to create foundations -- to give to a society flowing with both inequity and opportunity for the well-off to grow rich -- are incentives to altruistically further the public good.
